Generation I.Red: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
Generation I.Yellow: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
Generation I.Stadium: A dopey Pokémon that remains in a daze except when fishing with its tail. Awake or asleep, there is little difference.

Generation II.Gold: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
Generation II.Silver: A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.
Generation II.Crystal: It is always so absent-minded that it won't react, even if its flavorful tail is bitten.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pok é mon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
Generation III.Sapphire: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pok é mon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
Generation III.Emerald: It catches prey by dipping its tail in water at the side of a river. But it often forgets what it is doing and spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
Generation III.FireRed: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

Generation IV.Diamond: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation IV.Pearl: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation IV.Platinum: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.

Generation V.Black: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation V.White: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation V.Black 2: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation V.White 2: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

Generation VI.X: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
Generation VI.Y: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.

Generation VII.Sun: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn't really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn't particularly bothered.
Generation VII.Moon: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can easily be found lying around, they're a precious ingredient for cooking.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.

Generation VIII.Sword: Although this Pokémon is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke's diet.
Generation VIII.Shield: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It gives off a stimulating scent because of chemicals that have seeped into its body from the spice that it eats as its staple food.
Generation IX.Violet: It uses its tail to fish, but the scent of the spice emanating from its tail ensures its catches are always lacking.
